thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Oil Ticks Up on Potential U.S.-North Korea Meeting

author: Neanda Salvaterra
title: Oil Ticks Up on Potential U.S.-North Korea Meeting
text:
Oil prices gained on Friday, lifted by positive economic data, rising stocks and the possibility of a meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.
Light, sweet crude for April delivery advanced $1.66, or 2.8%, to $61.78 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange, breaking a two-day losing streak. Brent, the global benchmark, rose $1.71, or 2.7%, to $65.33 a barrel.
